docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: To set up a documentation site like this, we used uv for dependency management and mkdocs-material for the theme.

docs.title: 1. Initialize Project
docs.text:
First, create a new project directory and initialize it with uv:

mkdir -p ~/RAGprojects
cd ~/RAGprojects
uv init rag-notes --no-package
cd rag-notes

docs.title: 3. Create MkDocs Components
docs.text:
Initialize the MkDocs structure:

uv run mkdocs new .

This creates mkdocs.yml and docs/index.md.

docs.title: 4. Run Development Server
docs.text:
To see your changes in real-time:

uv run mkdocs serve

docs.title: Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text: MkDocs makes it easy to deploy your documentation to GitHub Pages using the gh-deploy command.

docs.title: 1. Deploy Command
docs.text:
To build and deploy your site:

uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

This command will automatically: 1. Build your static site. 2. Commit the result to the gh-pages branch. 3. Push that branch to GitHub.

docs.title: 2. Verify Deployment
docs.text:
After a few moments, your site should be live at: https://<username>.github.io/<repo-name>/

For example: https://Rishita95.github.io/rag-notes/

docs.title: 3. Troubleshooting
docs.text: If the site doesn't appear: - Check the Settings > Pages section in your GitHub repository. - Ensure the source is set to the gh-pages branch.

docs.title: Upload to GitHub
docs.text: Once your project is initialized, you can version control it with Git and push it to GitHub.

docs.title: 1. Initialize Git
docs.text:
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit"

docs.title: 2. Create Repository
docs.text:
Use the GitHub CLI to create a new repository and push your code:

gh repo create rag-notes --source=. --remote=origin --push --public

Note: If you encounter authentication or email privacy errors, verify your gh auth status and git config settings.

docs.title: 3. Push Changes
docs.text:
If the initial push doesn't work or you need to set the upstream branch:

git push --set-upstream origin main
